availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Sanks Brisbin (Superintendent of U.S. Army troops in Kentucky)

body.p: Centre County, Pennsylvania, teacher, editor, and soldier. Pennsylvania native. Married to Mary "Jane" Brisbin. Father of Caroline Brisbin. Attended Boalsburg Academy. Editor in Centre County in 1860. Commissioned as second lieutenant in the First Dragoons in the U.S. Army on April 26, 1861. Served in the 6th U. S. Cavalry Regiment as captain from 1862 to 1863. Served in the 5th U.S. Colored Cavalry as colonel from March 1, 1864. Brevetted major general of volunteers on May 2, 1865. Superintendent of U.S. Army troops in Kentucky in spring 1865. Mustered out of service on January 15, 1866.
